Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with handle zone; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with two faded added white bands at junction of wall and handle zone; exterior: at left at top painted decoration akin to ivy leaf or goat's hoof; below, at junction with handle zone, zigzag; in handle zone, handle frill pattern near handle; to the right, dotted concentric circles; below, glazed area..
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Group of Chalices with Dotted Concentric Circles because of the decoration around the handle zone and between the handles (Lemos 1991, 70).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 70, p. 239, no. 197)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0192) (phase 2)
